image.altText: A man outside court.

props.synopsis: A driver who ran a red light and hit Adelaide grandmother Joan McCaskill at a pedestrian crossing, causing her death, is handed a suspended sentence, with a judge saying the elderly perpetrator is "genuinely sorry" for the "catastrophic consequences" of the crash.

title.children: Elderly driver avoids jail after 'gross inattention' at pedestrian crossing caused grandmother's death

image.altText: Interiors of the South Australian Museum 2024-04-26 09:04:00

props.synopsis: Donors who gifted $1 million to the South Australian Museum fear the proposed restructure would make it a "mere repository of collections", and a former employee says reducing the number of researchers would be a "tragedy".

title.children: SA Museum's major donors describe feeling 'let down' as scientist says proposed revamp undervalues science

image.altText: A man standing in a park

props.synopsis: The sister of Beverley Hanley, who was allegedly murdered by Steven Hainsworth, has emotionally recalled how she discovered the crime scene.

title.children: Woman recounts finding sister's body 'just laying there' after alleged murder

image.altText: a woman and a man smiling to the camera with Adelaide Oval lit up in the background at night

props.synopsis: A man has died and another is expected to face a murder charge after an alleged assault at a hotel in Adelaide's north-west earlier this month.

title.children: Adelaide man to face murder charge after victim dies in hospital from alleged punch

image.altText: Driver Sang Van Huynh with a cap and glasses walks outside court

props.synopsis: A truck driver who ran a red light and hit two 16-year-old Adelaide high school students, shattering the "dreams and aspirations" of one who was left with a brain injury, is ordered to do community service but has avoided jail.

title.children: Truck driver who ran red light outside school and hit students gets suspended sentence

image.altText: A man with grey hair and beard leans over bushfire bunker built into ground

props.synopsis: An Adelaide Hills father installed a six-person bushfire bunker at his property after the 2019 Cudlee Creek bushfire, without first seeking planning approvals — now, the council have issued a removal notice — a decision which he is appealing.

title.children: Daniel Katz installed a 'last resort' bunker after fleeing a bushfire. He's been told to remove it

image.altText: A composite of Kamala Harris and Donald Trump.

props.synopsis: There's an eerie quiet about what potentially is looming as a future crisis point for the US economy. Neither party is addressing America's burgeoning debt levels and the yawning gap between its income and its outlays.

title.children: Trump and Harris are on opposite sides of the political spectrum, but little divides them on this one issue

image.altText: A mother is looking down at her premature baby daughter and smiling, while cuddling her

props.synopsis: A widely used test that determines whether women are in premature labour has been discontinued, and doctors say losing access could put further strain on emergency transport services in rural and remote areas.

title.children: After being born at 27 weeks, a test that helped ensure the safe arrival of this baby is being discontinued

image.altText: A man in a cap, with a whistle in his mouth points directly at the camera. It is night and another police officer is behind him.

props.synopsis: As the Middle East teeters on the precipice of regional war, ABC's Four Corners went where few Western journalists are allowed and got a glimpse of the regime's power.

title.children: Our trip inside Iran was a closely managed affair, then we got a glimpse of the regime's control

image.altText: John Setka sitting behind a number of microphones at a Melbourne media conference.

props.synopsis: Mr Setka claims former Workplace Relations Minister Tony Burke agreed to forgo appointing administrators to the CFMEU in exchange for the union boss's resignation.

title.children: PM says former union boss's claim he was left 'trembling' after elevator conversation is 'nonsense'

image.altText: Maggie Beer joins two female residents at the dining hall of an aged care home in Perth.

props.synopsis: In a statement on social media on Sunday night, her family said she fell at home, sustaining minor bone fractures and related injuries.

title.children: Australian food icon Maggie Beer injured after fall at home

image.altText: Jim Chalmers wears a navy suit, looking solemnly off camera.

props.synopsis: Treasurer Jim Chalmers has accused the Opposition Leader Peter Dutton of deliberately and "pathologically" seeking to divide the nation after two weeks of heated debate over Gaza visas.

title.children: Chalmers ramps up attacks on 'dangerous' and 'divisive' Dutton

image.altText: A man surveys a large pile of debris, which used to be his home.

props.synopsis: Russia launches about 200 missiles and drones at Ukraine, killing seven people and striking energy facilities nationwide, Kyiv says, while neighbouring NATO member Poland reports a drone has probably entered its airspace.

title.children: Russia hits Ukraine's power grid with 'most massive' attack of the war

image.altText: Two satellite images side by side from 2020 and 2024. The latter shows an area of forest has been cleared.

props.synopsis: European supermarkets won't buy beef from Brazil due to concerns about land clearing in the Amazon. Now conservationists are urging Coles and Woolworths to follow suit to combat deforestation in Australia.

title.children: 16,000 hectares of forests found flattened on beef farms and 'people don't even know it's happening'

image.altText: An Afghan woman and a girl walk in a street in Kabul

props.synopsis: Virtue laws introduced by the Taliban ban women from speaking or showing their faces in public as a senior UN official called it an extension of the "already intolerable restrictions" on Afghan women.

title.children: 'Sound of a female voice' banned in public across Afghanistan as UN decries virtue laws

image.altText: A bright red and white Coles sign at a supermarket at night.

props.synopsis: Coles has posted a $1.1b full-year, after-tax profit, citing stronger supermarket sales and acting to limit losses from theft, with the ASX 200 index tipped to open flat. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Coles posts $1.1b full-year profit, citing stronger supermarket sales

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Breaking down some of the Coles results

image.altText: A machine with many yellow circles inside a white background.

props.synopsis: Scientists have yet to find evidence of WIMPs — one of the main contenders for dark matter — in the most sensitive test yet made. We explain what the new results mean.

title.children: The world's most sensitive detector has found no sign of dark matter. So where is it?

image.altText: An older man with grey hair, wearing a pink shirt, speaks into a microphone.

props.synopsis: United Nations Secretary-General António Guterres implores major polluters and developed nations like Australia to rapidly cut emissions and phase out coal and gas, warning the Pacific is on the brink of climate catastrophe.

title.children: UN secretary-general calls on major polluters to show leadership to prevent Pacific climate catastrophe

image.altText: Two women wearing hijabs in conversation at a table in a tent. One holds a baby with a small girl at her side

props.synopsis: United Nations humanitarian aid operations in Gaza grind to a halt after Israel issued new evacuation orders for Deir Al-Balah in the central Gaza Strip, according to a senior UN official.

title.children: UN aid in Gaza halted after Israel evacuation orders

image.altText: Twisted metal of a large truck at night

props.synopsis: Ambulance officers with minor injuries continued to carry out their duties to treat five people involved in a Bruce Highway crash.

title.children: Ambulances collide on way to serious multi-vehicle truck crash

image.altText: A woman holding her hands together and smiling to reporters

props.synopsis: Convicted murderer Jessica Kumala Wongso has become the talk of the town in Indonesia after she was released from prison.

title.children: Why has public opinion flipped on Indonesia's 'iced coffee murderer'?

image.altText: A woman in her fifties takes a selfie next to her dog sitting on a couch in her apartment.

props.synopsis: A handful of new projects are aiming to change the direction of social housing by focusing on designs that encourages community cohesion and create homes tenants can be proud of.

title.children: Suddenly homeless at 50, Tanya never imagined social housing could be a 'utopia'

image.altText: Man in a suit on the Q+A television set.

props.synopsis: George Brandis, a former Liberal MP and foreign diplomat, tells Q+A that Kamala Harris has to win because Donald Trump would start World War III.

title.children: 'I'm hoping Kamala wins': George Brandis says Trump is 'too dangerous' to return to White House

image.altText: A man smiling

props.synopsis: French President Emmanuel Macron says there was no political motive in the arrest of Mr Durov, the billionaire Russian founder of Telegram, a popular messaging and social media app akin to WhatsApp.

title.children: French prosecutors say Pavel Durov was arrested over child porn and drug trafficking on Telegram app

image.altText: A woman in a race wheelchair

props.synopsis: This year's Paralympics play host to more female athletes than ever before — but putting together quotas and prioritising medal events has been described as "the biggest jigsaw puzzle".

title.children: There'll be 80 more female athletes at the Paralympics in Paris, but some say participation needs to change 'at a grassroots level'

image.altText: Alexei Popyrin

props.synopsis: Alexei Popyrin and Maya Joint both start the US Open with straight set victories, as seven Australians start their campaigns on day one of the tournament.

title.children: Popyrin and Joint get Australia off to a winning start at the US Open, as Birrell bows out

image.altText: A middle-aged to older man with white hair in a blue and white tracksuit and glasses looks serious.

props.synopsis: Sven-Göran Eriksson, the first non-British manager of England's football team, has died at the age of 76.

title.children: Former England manager Sven-Göran Eriksson dies aged 76

image.altText: A weather map showing high temperatures in Australia's north

props.synopsis: Temperatures across the Kimberley have reached 41.6 degrees Celsius, establishing a new national record for winter temperatures.

title.children: Unseasonal heat breaks Australia's winter temperature record

image.altText: Woman with cup in hand sits on couch with laptop on lap at home

props.synopsis: The new laws were put in place to combat burnout and poor mental health associated with the workplace. Here's how they work.

title.children: Questions answered about how the right to disconnect laws will affect you

image.altText: Packets of the drug naloxone in nasal spray form.

props.synopsis: An international naloxone advocate says the anti-overdose medication should be as accessible as fire extinguishers and defibrillators, as deadly synthetic opioids infiltrate Australia's drug market.

title.children: 'They shouldn't be left to die because they made a mistake': Calls for Australian nightspots to stock naloxone

image.altText: Hazara sisters Fatemah and Hamida now call Mansfield in Victoria home.

props.synopsis: Migrant women want the "older generations" to listen to young people about forced marriage, saying more education is needed as federal police and governments tackle the issue.

title.children: Women urge more action on 'terrifying' issue of forced marriage in Australia

image.altText: Nick Dametto criticises domestic violence policing

props.synopsis: Katter's Australia Party MP Nick Dametto has prompted a backlash after criticising the way domestic violence is policed and saying people should be able to "sort stuff out for themselves".

title.children: North Queensland MP's domestic violence podcast comments labelled 'irresponsible'

image.altText: A red and white truck parked on a grey glacier.

props.synopsis: The cave, located at the Breiðamerkurjökull glacier, collapsed as a group of 23 tourists were visiting the site on a tour.

title.children: Icelandic ice cave collapses, killing a tourist
